title: how to deal with new Firefox (11/6/20)
content:
I opened Firefox today and all of my tab, bookmarks, logins, etc. were lost. Here is the message I received: "Changes to your Firefox profile What changed?

This installation of Firefox has a new profile. A profile is the set of files where Firefox saves information such as bookmarks, passwords, and user preferences.

In order to make it easier and safer to switch between installations of Firefox (including Firefox, Firefox ESR, Firefox Beta, Firefox Developer Edition, and Firefox Nightly), this installation now has a dedicated profile. It does not automatically share your saved information with other Firefox installations.

You have not lost any personal data or customizations. If you’ve already saved information to Firefox on this computer, it is still available in another Firefox installation."

My question: I have not logged into my Firefox "profile" for a long time, but have been using the browser daily. It appears that my bookmarks and saved logins have not been saved since I last logged in (not sure when this was). So, can I use some of my history files to restore my saved bookmarks and logins from my last session? If yes, how do I do this? I am not a Firefox whiz. I have located the app data folder and have a lot of jasonlz4 files that I could conceptually use for this, but I don't know how. thanks for your help!

title: Firefox zeigt nichts mehr an - nicht einmal das Menü Einstellungen
content:
Folgende Ausgangssituation: Ich habe einen neuen Computer mit Win10, darauf habe ich Firefox installiert und alles lief perfekt. Dann habe ich in den Apps von Win10 4x Visual C ++ Redistributable gefunden 2015-2019 glaube ich. Ich dachte die wären von einem anderen Prog. das ich vor ein paar Tagen installiert hatte und habe die alle 4 deinstalliert. Ab da an hat Firefox keinen Inhalt mehr angezeigt. Die erst noch offenen Seiten hatten funktioniert. Aber neue Tabs blieben leer.

Was habe ich alles gemacht? Rechner neu gestartet Firefox deinstalliert und neu installiert (da kam dann eine Fehlermeldung daß eine dll fehlt. Visual Studios geholt und installiert - jetzt ist Visual C ++ Redistributabl 2019 und diese fehlende dll vorhanden. Firefox neu installiert - ging ohne Fehlermeldung, aber Anzeigen tut er immer noch nichts (nur leere Seite) Alle Treiber noch mal installiert.

Trotzdem geht nichts - ich bekomme nur eine leere Seite. Keine Eingabe ändert etwas daran. Firewall gibt es keine.

Was kann ich noch tun? Außer Win10 neu zu installieren - was ich vermeiden möchte...

title: Scroll wheel not scroll the page, only when the window is active.
content:
I have had multiple instances (maybe 4 times in 5 months) where the browser begins to refuse to accept sroll wheel inputs. The scroll wheel functions as intended when using other applications or when firefox is an inactive window (i.e. I can scroll as intended when I have the active cursor within Visual Studio). In the instances that I have noticed the exact moment that the issue begins I would note that Twitter was the active tab. The issue will then persist until the browser is either reset or reinstalled. Rebooting the operating systems does not help.

This issue affects exclusively my work laptop, I've never encountered this issue before on my personal desktop where I use a near identical configuration (OS, firefox version, extensions & mouse). This difference leads me to believe that the issue may reside in some piece of software that either Dell or my employer has installed on this machine but I don't have any suspicions as to the culprit.

I've explored solutions from my searches on both google and the mozilla support pages to no avail. From these searches I have tried solutions including; altering firefox hardware acceleration settings and altering the Windows mouse scroll wheel settings (which did seem to help in one instance of this issue but forced me to use a massive number of lines per scroll stop).

As mentioned above I have been able to resolved this issue before using firefox's reset function in the past but this time the issue has carried across the reset and even in to another install of firefox (v83.0b9 on the developer edition channel).

Any help or suggestions that can be offered would be greatly appreciated. The provided troubleshooting data may not come in handy as this query is being written directly after a reset.

title: Steam Download slows down when Firefox is running
content:
I noticed a strange behaviour since yesterday when trying to download a game while running firefox. When i start a download i get the full downloadspeed. But when i open up firefox the DL speed drops right away and sometimes even reaches 0.

I just have to run FF without visiting any site (home tab). I dont get a throttled DL speed when using other game clients. I can download files via FF itself without any problems. After closing FF the DL sometimes gets back up, sometimes its stuck at a low level.

I have a recently installed system. Im running

Windows 10, 2004 (newest updates) AMD CPU and X570 board, newest chipset drivers. Kaspersky and Malwarebytes (tho i still have the problem after deinstalling them)

Anyone can confirm this or has a solution to the problem?

I tried:

  • Using other browser while DLing in Steam: no issue.
  • Deleting/reinstalling FF, starting without Addons (ublock, noscript): same issue
  • setting up a VM with Kaspersky, Malwarebytes, Steam and FF (tho on a different device and inet): no issue
  • if i start FF and nothing else i dont see any movement in task-manager @ CPU and Network graphs
  • i dont have any tuner or optimizer installed. Just drivers and game clients from reliable sources
creator: paulpaulsenscreenshot

title: I am logged out of Google and Instagram every three days (aprox.)
content:
Hello,

as the title says, I am contiuously logged out of my Google and Instagram account when using Firefox both mobile and desktop (Android and Windows 10) every three days or so.

I have no more explenation for this since I have tried everything that came to my mind. Does anyone have a similar problem or, even better, a solution?

Things that I have tried/ensured so far: - Privacy settings: browser history etc. are deleted after closing firefox, but not the cookies and also not the saved log-ins. Furthermore, even after I am logged out of the mentioned pages, there are still cookies of Instagram and Google saved in Firefox, I have checked that. - I have not changed those settings in two years or so, the problem occours since a few weeks. - My only addon is uBlock, deactivating it does not change the problem and I have also had this installed since more that two years. - All my other logins (Amazon, eBay and so on) are not affected by this. - I have no applications on my phone or computer that deletes cookies automatically, also that would not make sence to my since only Google and Instagram are affected and even further, cookies of those are not even deleted so the reason seems to be elsewhere.

Thank you in advance! SirGarfield

content:
Firefox won't open Yahoo as my home page whenever Firefox has been closed either when shutting off the computer or just closing down Firefox.

I am using Windows 7 and Avast. When I go to Cookies and Site Data, manage data and remove all the Yahoo pages it will open, I have also cleared all the cache and history. If I shut down Firefox and try to start it again it will not load the page.

I have changed to a few different home pages one at a time and shut down and restart Firefox and those pages will start as my homepage. It is just Yahoo.

I know this has been addressed a few times but nothing I have found seems to work.

Thanks in advance
creator: wmeinzer

title: can't get rid of padlock with exclamation point
content: I've searched everywhere, but none of the solutions works. It's one of my favorite sites: https://fivethirtyeight.com/live-blog/2020-election-results-coverage/ I can load it in chrome and safari, but I get these mixed content things and I can't tell firefox to trust the site. I really wanted to use firefox, but I'm way too frustrated right now. I'm heading back to chrome unless there's an easy answer. Thank you for your help.

title: Google Keep on Firefox 82.0.2 (64 bit) automatically remove the link on the website see.kmisln.com
content:
Hello community,

There's a weird behavior when using Google Keep on Firefox 82.0.2 as follows: open the Google keep (https://keep.google.com) create a new note, then paste the below link http://see.kmisln.com/offer?prod=2&ref=5111794 then suddenly this line of link is removed from the note.

If try to insert a blank space between '.com' and the forward slash, then this line will not be removed.

Even when I type the URL, ie. not pasting it into the note, this behavior still happens.

This issue does not happen to other links. It does not happen on Chrome. So weird!!!

Anyone experienced this issue, please kindly share your work around or fix.

Thank you
creator: mr.vudoan

Is there a setting I'm missing somewhere?

title: No Option For YouTube Casting
content: I've been using Firefox on my desktop to cast YouTube onto a TV for the last few months. Today I realized I didn't have any option to cast to the TV anymore. It worked on Chrome but I was wondering if there was a fix for Firefox.
creator: metedice

title: Firefox 81.0.2 can't sign up for 'Get Status Updates ' on fedex.com. IE 11 can.
content:
When I go to fedex.com, (https://www.fedex.com/apps/fedextrack/?action=track) enter a tracking number, click on Track, I can see the travel history, etc but cannot seem to complete the 'Get Status Updates'. I am able to enter all the requested information and when I enter my email address for the second time at the bottom, 'Submit' turns from gray to Orange but clicking it does nothing. When I do the exact same thing in IE 11, it works correctly and I get the 'Notifications have been sent to the following recipient(s) .' as expected.

I am using Firefox 81.0.2 on Windows 7 Pro SP1. Fedex updates have not worked for several Firefox versions.

Any suggestions would be appreciated.
creator: MikeZZ
